document.title: Iowa Career and Technical Education Applied Sciences, Technology, Engineering and Manufacturing Standards

91E2FD5930D14BBAA01D861AAE3631CF.description:
Know how scheduling, quality control, accident prevention and inventory
control are used efficiently and appropriately in a machining and forming
production management system.

F3E4D15E9ADB44DC8916CC79A84D1965.description:
Understand that a machining and forming production management system
includes planning, engineering, organizing and controlling resources and
manufacturing processes.

152632D24CD94F98A6D1FCF217DA08D0.description:
Understand corporate structures that affect machining and forming
production.

1E02F40DC8F94E22A5E22E42FAF00E78.description:
Students understand how a manufacturing company is organized and the
elements of a machining and forming production management system.

05848EFEEC5C4CF3BAFBE7AB958753F7.description:
Select appropriate tools, processes and equipment to successfully produce
formed parts or products.

0266D0F8772E4E10A3E15EA6F8BF6AF6.description:
Use various forming tools and equipment, such as rolls, brakes, dies and
presses, to manufacture parts and products.

26812E9775C1468EB4D03633612FEF3B.description:
Students understand the operation and functions of machine tools in production
and prototype work.

C06B3CE0472641B59B7F8F9DE8D27857.description:
Select appropriate machining processes and equipment to produce
prototypes or production parts or products.

835D0DE3E6CD43AFA76CF2579924B918.description:
Use various machine tools, such as lathes, mills, drills and saws, to
produce parts and products.

DDFFB0A17465443194B042DA3336C1BB.description:
Students understand the operation and functions of machine tools in production
and prototype work.

0E68963EC0204C1396806220C40DF590.description:
Understand the importance of maintaining documentation for machining
and forming systems.

36BA538C41D441098943E22EEF56BFE2.description:
Manufacture parts or products from industrial materials by using machining
and forming systems, such as electrical discharge, laser cutting, chemical
machining and chemical bonding processes.

584C14C9F7904CEBA84A0E2CC0ED0FFA.description:
Students understand various machining and forming manufacturing systems that
require standard hand and machine tools.

7ECE579E3F984602B34AEF8AF732066D.description:
Use computers to design and produce machined and formed products,
write numerical control programs and control robots.

9C28606B16EE498396560332E9C9EFFC.description:
Understand the processes involved in the following machining and forming
manufacturing systems: “just in time,” tool design, design for manufacturing,
flexible manufacturing systems and materials resource planning.

095AA512C710448B8A68147A2AB8E3A2.description:
Understand materials and processes in relation to machining and forming
manufacturing systems.

E366B41DB43C4D01BE89CB07E45C7BC1.description:
Students understand various machining and forming automated manufacturing
systems, tool design, design for manufacturing, flexible manufacturing systems
and materials resource planning.

7E392DFBE0C340AA9418D2C2669572F6.description:
Select and use appropriate machining and forming tools, equipment and
inspection devices to manufacture parts or products.

46597CF051264CF4AA7AE0DF434DDF2E.description:
Understand the characteristics of various machining and forming systems
used in conventional manufacturing industries, such as open dies, smith
forging, blow molding, stamping, drawing, shearing, chip removal, milling,
turning and electrical discharge systems.

4E8AC362CCDD425DB4B678B73071BCEF.description:
Students understand various machining and forming manufacturing systems that
require standard hand and machine tools.

12B86D39140B4EB38656D3600345BA01.description:
Know how to troubleshoot performance problems of machining and forming
systems.

C587AA967C0240CDBF9101EE7B8488F0.description:
Know how to perform a continuous online quality control inspection of
machined and formed parts.

284A5782D2F744709248E1839C3627B7.description:
Know the reasons for inspection and quality control in the manufacture of
machined and formed parts.

092E85581EA04D039D711C731A997DF9.description:
Students understand the purposes and processes of inspection and quality
control in machining and forming manufacturing processes.

AADE329FDB264CAA8F8521F8BFC31EF2.description:
Select and use appropriate machined- and formed-part finishing processes,
such as coating, plating and anodizing to meet specific product design
criteria.

829910F030E84A8DA3A0A8750E87CCF0.description:
Understand and use processes such as dipping, plating, spraying and flow
coating to finish machined and formed materials.

08946370EF8F4E5FA4B854970C7C9730.description:
Students understand finishing processes and the differences between various
types of finishing materials used in the manufacturing of machined and formed
parts and products.

CBEB2239B1D34150A0CEEE914F6226FA.description:
Select and use the tools, such as taps and dies, wrenches and spot
welders, and the assembly process appropriate to the design criteria of a
specific machined and formed product.

E387AF6AA6F046A6ACAA2ECA046DE53D.description:
Students understand various types of machine and forming assembly processes,
such as flow, pressure, cold and adhesive bonding and mechanical fasteners.

F292D352C8CA4B9FA57A6239AC439D87.description:
Use machine tools, such as machine lathes, milling machines, drilling
machines, power hacksaws and band saws and forming equipment, such
as presses, brakes, ironworkers and stake benches, to cut, shape,
combine and form manufactured parts or use various methods for the
assembly of machined and formed parts and products in manufacturing,
such as thread cutting and bonding agents.

2FC4186309F4499B839A0D3261D580AC.description:
Understand the qualities of various raw and industrial materials and how
these qualities affect the ability of the materials to be processed in the
manufacturing of machined and formed parts and products.

DD46FE6E1B65461681B3A03F5B530BEB.description:
Students understand how materials can be processed through the use of
machine tools, such as milling, drilling, turning and shaping machines and
forming equipment, such as dies, presses and rolls.

3DA8DFB6E758443D8E36A9CE8578CC05.description:
Use current information technology ideation and design process systems in
the manufacturing of machined and formed parts and products.

BB33F42CFF70438F90F9A67F54FEC0C1.description: Understand the design parameters across machine tool and materials forming organizational levels.

20D9072A5050444CA71D6A01D906EE30.description:
Interpret scaled machine tool and materials forming prints; gather design
and materials information; perform calculations and use the detail to plan,
lay out and produce parts or finished products that meet applicable
standards.

8389063A02ED402FA78B034638861B75.description:
Students understand the planning and layout operations used in machine tool
and materials forming processes.
